official_title: To provide for a National Commission on Board and Care Facility Quality to review and recommend standards for board and care facilities.
short_title: National Commission on Board and Care Facility Quality Act of 1991

summary.text: National Commission on Board and Care Facility Quality Act of 1991 - Establishes the National Commission on Board and Care Facility Quality to: (1) examine existing quality, health, and safety requirements for board and care facilities and the enforcement of those requirements; (2) recommend the appropriate role of the Federal, State, and local governments; and (3) make recommendations regarding standards and enforcement. Requires that the National Academy of Sciences, through the Institute of Medicine, be requested to provide administrative support for the Commission. Requires that a specified amount be made available from the Federal Old-Age and Survivors Insurance Trust Fund to carry out this Act.

titles.title: National Commission on Board and Care Facility Quality Act of 1991
To provide for a National Commission on Board and Care Facility Quality to review and recommend standards for board and care facilities.
